Package it.polimi.ingsw.model

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.ingsw.model.Player
  • public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represent a single playing Player, it contains all infos available to the player

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private Ammo ammo
      The set of ammo the Player have, for each color (Blue, Red, Yellow) a number from 0 to 3
      PlayerColor color
      The color of the Player (one among Blue, Green, Grey, Violet, Yellow)
      private Square currentSquare
      The Square the Player is currently in
      private java.util.List<PlayerColor> damage
      The list of damages, in the form of PlayerColor, the Player has, the length is between 0 and 12
      IEvent<Player,​Player> damagedEvent
      The event that is invoked when a Player is damaged, it notifies the Match
      IEvent<Player,​Player> deathEvent
      The event that is invoked when a Player becomes dead, it notifies the Match
      private boolean finalFrenzy
      It states if the Player has died after the final frenzy has been activated
      GameBoard gameBoard
      The GameBoard the Player is currently playing in
      private java.util.List<WeaponCard> loadedWeapons
      The list of loaded weapons the Player has, which are the weapons ready to shoot, the length is between 0 and 3
      private java.util.List<PlayerColor> mark
      The list of marks, in the form of PlayerColor, the Player has, the length is between 0 and 12
      private static int MAX_AMMO  
      private static int MAX_DAMAGES  
      private static int MAX_MARKS  
      private static int MAX_POWER_UPS  
      private static int MAX_POWER_UPS_RESPAWN  
      java.lang.String name
      The name of the Player, it's unique in the Match the Player is currently playing in
      private int points
      The score a Player currently got
      private PowerUpSet powerupSet
      The set of powerUps the Player has, it contains a total of 3 PowerUpCard among EndStart, InTurn and CounterAttack
      private int skull
      The number of skulls the Player currently have, it identify how many time it has died and how many points it gives
      private java.util.List<WeaponCard> unloadedWeapons
      The list of unloaded weapons the Player has, which are the weapons that cannot shoot until reloaded, the length is between 0 and 3

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Player​(Player player, GameBoard clonedGameBoard, Square clonedSquare)
      This constructor is a copy constructor, it create a new Player that is the copy of a given one
      Player​(java.lang.String name, PlayerColor color, GameBoard gameBoard)
      The constructor create a new Player given the name, the color and the GameBoard, it also sets at a default value the various attributes

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void addBlue​(int val)
      This method adds or subtract blue ammo from the Player, blue ammo must always be a number between 0 and 3
      void addDamage​(Player shooter, int val)
      This method adds damages to the Player and converts marks of the same color into damages
      void addDamageNoMarks​(Player shooter, int val)
      This method adds damages to the Player but does not converts marks of the same color into damages
      void addMark​(Player shooter, int val)
      This method adds marks to the Player, the number of marks can be maximum 3 for each color
      void addPoints​(int newPoints)
      This method adds the points the Player has gained through a kill
      void addPowerUpCard()
      This method draws a PowerUpCard from the PowerUpDeck and assign it to the Player, with this method a Player cannot have more than 3 PowerUpCards at the same time
      void addPowerUpCard​(PowerUpCard powerUpCard)
      This method adds a specific PowerUpCard to the Player
      void addPowerUpCardRespawn()
      This method draws a PowerUpCard from the PowerUpDeck and assign it to the Player, with this method a Player can have a fourth PowerUpCard, but it will be discarded at the respawn
      void addRed​(int val)
      This method adds or subtract red ammo from the Player, red ammo must always be a number between 0 and 3
      void addWeapon​(WeaponCard weaponCard)
      This method adds a specific weapon to the Player
      void addYellow​(int val)
      This method adds or subtract yellow ammo from the Player, yellow ammo must always be a number between 0 and 3
      void clearDamage()
      Remove all the damage from the player when it spawns
      Ammo getAmmo()  
      Square getCurrentSquare()  
      java.util.List<PlayerColor> getDamage()  
      java.util.List<Ammo> getDiscardableAmmo()
      This method returns a list of Ammo that can be discarded with the Targeting Scope PowerUpCard
      java.util.List<WeaponCard> getLoadedWeapons()  
      java.util.List<PlayerColor> getMark()  
      java.lang.String getName()  
      int getPoints()  
      java.util.List<PowerUpCard> getPowerUps()  
      PowerUpSet getPowerupSet()  
      int getSkull()  
      int getTotalAmmo()
      This method returns the total number of ammo contained in the ammo set
      java.util.List<WeaponCard> getUnloadedWeapons()  
      java.util.List<WeaponCard> getWeapons()
      This method returns all the weapons the Player has, both loaded and unloaded
      boolean isFinalFrenzy()  
      void reloadWeapon​(WeaponCard weaponCard)
      This method moves a weapon from the loaded list to the unloaded list
      void removePowerUpCard​(PowerUpCard powerUpCard)
      This method remove a specific PowerUpCard from the Player
      void removeWeapon​(WeaponCard weaponCard)
      This method removes a specific weapon from the Player
      void setCurrentSquare​(Square currentSquare)  
      void setFinalFrenzy()
      This method sets the finalFrenzy value to true when a player dies during the final frenzy
      void setSkull​(int skull)  
      void unloadWeapon​(WeaponCard weaponCard)
      This method moves a weapon from the unloaded list to the loaded list

    • Constructor Detail

      • Player

        public Player​(java.lang.String name,
              PlayerColor color,
              GameBoard gameBoard)
        The constructor create a new Player given the name, the color and the GameBoard, it also sets at a default value the various attributes
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the Player
        color - The color of the Player
        gameBoard - The GameBoard the Player is playing in

      • Player

        public Player​(Player player,
              GameBoard clonedGameBoard,
              Square clonedSquare)
        This constructor is a copy constructor, it create a new Player that is the copy of a given one
        Parameters:
        player - The Player that has to be copied
        clonedGameBoard - The already cloned GameBoard
        clonedSquare - The already cloned Square

    • Method Detail

      • addBlue

        public void addBlue​(int val)
        This method adds or subtract blue ammo from the Player, blue ammo must always be a number between 0 and 3
        Parameters:
        val - The number of blu ammo to addTarget to the Player, a negative value will subtract them

      • addRed

        public void addRed​(int val)
        This method adds or subtract red ammo from the Player, red ammo must always be a number between 0 and 3
        Parameters:
        val - The number of red ammo to addTarget to the Player, a negative value will subtract them

      • addYellow

        public void addYellow​(int val)
        This method adds or subtract yellow ammo from the Player, yellow ammo must always be a number between 0 and 3
        Parameters:
        val - The number of yellow ammo to addTarget to the Player, a negative value will subtract them

      • addPowerUpCard

        public void addPowerUpCard()
        This method draws a PowerUpCard from the PowerUpDeck and assign it to the Player, with this method a Player cannot have more than 3 PowerUpCards at the same time

      • addPowerUpCardRespawn

        public void addPowerUpCardRespawn()
        This method draws a PowerUpCard from the PowerUpDeck and assign it to the Player, with this method a Player can have a fourth PowerUpCard, but it will be discarded at the respawn

      • addPowerUpCard

        public void addPowerUpCard​(PowerUpCard powerUpCard)
        This method adds a specific PowerUpCard to the Player
        Parameters:
        powerUpCard - The card to addTarget to the Player

      • removePowerUpCard

        public void removePowerUpCard​(PowerUpCard powerUpCard)
        This method remove a specific PowerUpCard from the Player
        Parameters:
        powerUpCard - The card to remove from the Player

      • addDamage

        public void addDamage​(Player shooter,
                      int val)
        This method adds damages to the Player and converts marks of the same color into damages
        Parameters:
        shooter - The Player who is causing the damages
        val - The quantity of damages received by the Player

      • addDamageNoMarks

        public void addDamageNoMarks​(Player shooter,
                             int val)
        This method adds damages to the Player but does not converts marks of the same color into damages
        Parameters:
        shooter - The Player who is causing the damages
        val - The quantity of damages received by the Player

      • addMark

        public void addMark​(Player shooter,
                    int val)
        This method adds marks to the Player, the number of marks can be maximum 3 for each color
        Parameters:
        shooter - The Player who is causing the marks
        val - The quantity of marks received by the Player
